data.title: Switching to another app and returning to Godot causes scripts to reload from disk, losing unsaved changes
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10
Godot Version 2.0.3

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
If I have new, unsaved, code in a script and switch to another applications, when I return Godot the script is reloaded from disk and any unsaved changes are lost. Undo/Redo does not restore the changes.

I would expect when I returned to Godot that my unsaved changes would remain.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Enter new code into a script.
2. Switch to another app. Either CTRL+TAB or clicking on an app icon
3. Switch back to Godot.

data.title: Adds the invert() method to DVector.
data.body:
Satisfies #4601 
Previous PR #4604 

This effectively allows invert() to be used on the following types:
ByteArray, IntArray, RealArray, StringArray, Vector2Array, Vector3Array, ColorArray

Added local variables and vector lock, as suggested from #4604

data.title: Godot versioning
data.body:
http://godotengine.org/article/maintenance-release-godot-2-0-3 have something like:

"Ability to shrink all images x2 on load"
isn't that a feature? Why then it's 2.0.3 and not 2.1? Why there was bump to 2.0? There should be some info on how Godot versions itself...

Or just use http://semver.org/ ðŸ˜›

data.title: Node duplication positions under duplicated node, issue #964
data.body:
When duplicating a node it is now positioned under the node that was duplicated.

closes #964

data.title: IPv6 support
data.body:
It would be nice for Godot Networking to finally support IPv6, especially that most of ISPs begin to use v6 instead of v4 as a base.

With my new modem(router) I can't get the networking to work, since [Godot can't resolve the hostname](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/a895e2e372c9df2a9972f38134ae0ea9c8bf45a8/drivers/unix/ip_unix.cpp#L69) for IPv6 and my supposed IPv4 (which I don't even know how is obtained) doesn't respond to anything.

data.title: Can't save a image to disk (Android)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Android 6.0.1, Godot 2.0.2 stable.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Trying to save a image on disk from Sprite returns the following error: 

```
05-13 06:03:54.089 14508 14521 I godot   : ERROR: save_image: Method/Function Failed, returning: ERR_CANT_OPEN
05-13 06:03:54.089 14508 14521 I godot   :    At: drivers/png/resource_saver_png.cpp:132.
```

The same project works just fine on PC.

**Steps to reproduce:**
add a Sprite node and set a texture via editor, then try to save the image to disk using the code:

```
var sprite = get_node("Sprite")
var texture = sprite.get_texture()
var image = texture.get_data()
image.save_png("user://tmp.png")
```

it's not likely permission related, because if I create a image via code, it works as expected:

```
var image2 = Image(64, 64, false, Image.FORMAT_RGBA)
image2.save_png("user://tmp2.png")
```

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
https://www.dropbox.com/s/oisqr3etx4wiioj/godot-share.zip

data.title: Add zoom in tileset->tile selector within TileMap
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
OSX El Capitan

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I'm working with a relatively small tileset (16x16 tiles), so after setting up a tileset as per the "Using tilemaps" tutorial, I found that it was hard to pick correctly my list of tiles if they all look similar (and the naming doesn't help a lot when your tilesheet has 64*64 tiles).

The ability to zoom or change the size of the tile thumbnails would be incredibly helpful for me in this case.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Build a tileset from a tilesheet with 16x16 tiles
2. Add that tileset into a TileMap node
3. Have fun distinguishing between various, subtly different wall tiles :)

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
N/A

Here's an idea of the challenge:

![screen shot 2016-05-13 at 6 30 34 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10408/15246656/3b705264-18d4-11e6-8d94-d25349e5f71d.png)

data.body:

Mac OSX, godot 2.0.2 and latest github.
[tilemap_lights.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/262476/tilemap_lights.zip)

Running a scene with a tilemap and 2d lights shows a big performance drop (to aprox. 35fps) on OSX, the same project runs with a steady 60fps on windows (on the exact same machine).

**Steps to reproduce:**
Run the attached project on OSX.

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/29008381/tilemap_lights.zip

data.title: mouse_enter signal not working
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Mac OSX

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When I attach a mouse_enter signal connection with a Control node things aren't working correctly. At first it works but after adding and removing child nodes the signal no longer triggers.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. + Add new control node
2. Add script
3. Add connection signal on mouse_enter
4. Implement function -> print("signal hit")
5. Run
6. Undo some changes add some nodes remove some nodes. Run.

It may take a few tries but eventually it'll stop working.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/45209445/declicker.zip

data.title: Fix some errors in some rotation functions, also clarify that certainâ€¦
data.body: â€¦ parameters are expressed in radians

data.title: Set rotation functions
data.body: There are too many namings for the same function, set_rot, set_rotation, set_rotation_deg, set_rotationd, set_rotd, also there are thing like set_param functions that takes an angle, should we add things like PARAM_ANGLE_DEG, i think is too much bloat, there shoul be only one rotation type function either in degrees or radians and use deg2rad or rad2deg, also it is confusing that angles in the editor are expressed in degrees whereas angles in scripts are expresed in radians, probabily theres a good reason for that, but for beginners i dont think that is friendly.

data.title: Ability to use a plain color as splash screen rather than an image
data.body:
Since many games would rather have their own animated splash screen, it would be nice to be able to set a color to the splash that would be applied to the whole window during loading (and instead have a pure black color during engine loading, for example).

Currently, you have to use a pure black image as splash, it's kind of a hack (since you need an image editor to change the color).

data.title: _on_resize or No completion weird crash
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Arch Linux 64bit - Godot built from source 48dc4d92a8f3c9eb42456eda2433c6fcaff0c723
I run Godot via `primusrun` (Nvidia Optimis Laptop :-1: )

**Issue description** 
I'm working on my project - pseudo [terminal emulator for Godot](https://github.com/TeddyDD/gtern). It's basicly rewrite of my old project using new Godot features. Every time I try to add line 
`if x <= size.x:` to `transfer_to()` method in [buffer.gd](https://github.com/TeddyDD/gtern/blob/master/addons/terminal/buffer.gd) Godot crashes.

It should looks like this

``` gdscript
func transfer_to(buffer):
    for y in buffer.size.y:
        if y <= size.y:
```

`size` is Vector2D 

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Open my project in Godot
2. Open buffer.gd
3. Try to add `if y <= y.size:` line in `transfer_to(buffer):` method at the beggining of first loop (`for y in buffer.size.y`) 
**Note** I know that that line of code wouldn't work and I shoud use `range()` but I suppose that does not matter for now.
Project itself works, you can run it, works as expected.

I captured little video to show the issue:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z-6zQ851g7g&feature=youtu.be

Godot output: https://gist.github.com/TeddyDD/842a54a7fd045b202af1a0ccb0541297

This line might be relevant (or not?): https://github.com/TeddyDD/gtern/blob/master/addons/terminal/terminal.gd#L45 It was called by signal before _ready() (font was null) I'm talking about this because of this line from Godot output

```
ERROR: emit_signal: Error calling method from signal 'resized': 'Control(terminal.gd)::_on_resize': Method not found.
   At: core/object.cpp:1210.
```

**Link to minimal example project** 
Here is my project https://github.com/TeddyDD/gtern

Sorry if this not very precise issue description but this is pretty weird :confused:

data.title: Original array is affected when changed in function
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 Pro - Godot 2.0.2

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When an array is set into a function, it also affects the original one. This doesn't occur to variables, so I'm supposing it's not intended.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Use this code into your project:

```
var a = 0
var b = [0]

func _ready():
    varr(a)
    arr(b)
    print(a)
    print(b)

func arr(p):
    p[0] = 5

func varr(k):
    k = 5
```

Will print:
0
5

data.title: Remove nocpuid.c from builtin OpenSSL
data.body:
Fixes #4632

e97922f22038e9049ed4c2db5b3736dfaa0edde3 comments out `#define OPENSSL_CPUID_OBJ` in `opensslconf.h`, so OpenSSL defines `OPENSSL_cpuid_setup(void)` by itself, with the same empty definition: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/e97922f22038e9049ed4c2db5b3736dfaa0edde3/drivers/builtin_openssl2/crypto/cryptlib.c#L738

I wonder why it's commented out though

data.title: replaying an edited scene after a bug does not replay the former edited scene by default
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
official 2.0.2stable win64

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

Lets say I have two scene opened into the editor. Scene A and B.

When I work on Scene A and press the "Play the edited scene" (F6) and that a bug occurs into one of its scripts, the debugger appears and the "Play the edited scene" button is changed into a "Replay" button.

If I edit Scene B and press the "replay" button, this is Scene B that is played instead of Scene A that should be replayed.

data.title: Corrected two return types in Area2D

Corrected the return type of overlaps_body() and overlaps_area() in the Area2D class documentation: they are now booleans.

data.title: add some visual effects to where undo/redo occurs (feature request)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Official 2.0.2_stable win64

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

When I work on several scenes at the same time, the undo/redo stack apply to all the scenes.
Having one undo/redo stack per scene would be less confusing, but as @reduz  stated into #3511, it is not possible to change this behavior.

So, to make it less confusing, what about adding some visual effects to where a undo/redo is applied ?

For instance, when a property or a node is undone/redone, something like a red or yellow circle could brievely appear over the concerned item to attract eyes.

I think it would make easier to follow the undo/redo flow.

**Steps to reproduce:**

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

Check the image above.

data.title: JavaScript platform FTBFS with builtin OpenSSL: 'OPENSSL_cpuid_setup': symbol multiply defined!
data.body:
Both in master and 2.0 branches, since the upgrade to OpenSSL 1.0.2h.

The `platform=javascript` build fails with:

```
ERROR: Linking globals named 'OPENSSL_cpuid_setup': symbol multiply defined!
```

See e.g. https://travis-ci.org/GodotBuilder/godot-builds/jobs/129631090

@eska014 already fixed a similar issue in #4560 for Opus. We may have to check with the Emscripten devs if it's not an issue on their end though, if we only get a FTBFS with Emscripten.

This issue is preventing me from releasing 2.0.3 :/

data.title: the list of subdirectories into the "target path" dialog box of the 2d texture importer is not updated
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Official Godot 2.0.2stable win64

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When you import a 2D texture, you have to choose the target path using a dialog box.
If you created a new subdirectory into your project during the session, the list of directories into this dialog box will not show this new subdirectories, and there is no way to refresh it.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1) Open a project.
2) Manually create a new subdirectory into your project directory.
3) Click "import -> 2d texture".
4) Select your source.
5) Select the target path.

The new sub-directory is not displayed.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
